results.content: Pixel 5 - Another update broke the app!! VPN disconnects randomly after latest update. This a long standing issue that was fixed for a while but started again! Why is it so difficult to get the most important part of a VPN - stable connection and reliability is too much??
results.replyContent: We hear what you say and want to take a closer look at this incident since this Android issue should have been resolved with the latest update. Please send us a support request for this issue through the Get Help option found within the Settings of the VPN. This way we will be able to further assist you with the resolution of this problem. Regards,

results.content: Great app, easy to use, great privacy protection, only thing to improve is payment period options (i..e., quarterly, semi-monthly, annually); it only allows monthly payment as of now...
results.replyContent: Thank you for your comment! Unfortunately, we don't have a way to bill annually, semi-annually or quarterly outside France and Germany, we only have monthly plans. We've gotten a handful of requests for alternate payment cycles so it's something we are looking to implement in the future. Thank you for your feedback. Best regards,

results.content: Deleted my old review due to it not really reflecting my current opinion of the app. The only issue would be it disconnecting when dismissed, but it seems like that's fixed with the recent update. Solid work but a kill switch would be nice to have
results.replyContent: Hello! If you are using the Mozilla VPN to transfer data and your Internet connection becomes unstable or drops, the network connection on your device will be blocked to prevent your local IP address from being exposed. The kill switch is on by default on Windows, Android, iOS, Mac and Linux and there is no setting to turn it off. Best regards,

results.content: I'm still in testing stage.. 1 computer is not connected. Ubuntu. It's still not functioning correctly. But it could be me. So no judgement yet.
results.replyContent: Hi there! We‚Äôre sorry to hear that Mozilla VPN isn‚Äôt working on your Ubuntu computer. Please send us a support request for this issue through the Get Help option found within the Settings of the VPN client. This way we will be able to further assist you with the resolution of this problem.

results.content: I love the VPN. Easy to install and use. You might need to make it a little easier if you want my mom to use it and remember that older people are most at risk for phishing scams.
results.replyContent: Hello! Thank you for sharing your thoughts with us, we're always striving to improve our products and your feedback is invaluable in that goal! Warm regards,

results.content: Edit 2: Latest update appears to have fixed the issue of the VPN disconnecting when removed from the foreground, and I've updated my review. I hope the app continues working as expected, since it's a good, practical way to support Mozilla. // Edit 1: VPN disconnects when (a) I clear it from the foreground or, more problematically, (b) I hit the "back" button to return to the home screen after connecting. Both behaviors are terrible. // Original: My VPN connection now shuts off without warning, for no apparent reason. Tried clearing cache and uninstalling/reinstalling; didn't help. A VPN that continually shuts off without warning is worse than useless. I'm a fan of Mozilla and hope they fix this soon; otherwise, there's no point in subscribing.
results.replyContent: We appreciate your awesome comment! We're always striving to improve our products and your feedback is invaluable in that goal! Warm regards

results.content: I'm able to connect the VPN quickly, and network speed is good while connected. My issue is that I will disconnect from VPN and close the app, but it turns itself back ok and re-connects to the VPN in the background while I'm working in other apps. This happens even after uninstalling and reinstalling the app several times, and has been happening for approximately 3 months or so. It makes it very hard for me to want to recommend anyone use this app.
results.replyContent: Hi there! Thank you for sharing and we‚Äôre sorry to hear that Mozilla VPN isn‚Äôt working properly for you. Don't hesitate to send us a support request for this issue through the Get Help option found within the Settings of the VPN. This way we will be able to further assist you with the resolution of this problem.

results.content: I trust Mozilla to properly manage data and the only complaint I have is the passive battery drain that using the VPN adds. Otherwise, the app is quick, never provides a noticable drop in service speeds, and does what it's designed to do. Edit: It seems I was lucky. It stopped working after around two months of use. Just doesn't let me finish connecting. They close support tickets if they go unreplied to for a day. Really let down by Mozilla on this. No updates since 01/21 from a new app?
results.replyContent: Hi there! We‚Äôre sorry to hear the Mozilla VPN is not connecting on your device. If you wouldn‚Äôt mind sending us a DM, we'll be more than happy to look into this for you. Regards

results.content: I only use this when I am away from home/office and need to help ensure my connection is secure on unknown wifi. It has worked well, and reliably, for that. One note: I had been a member of their beta program, and had significant problems that they were completely unable to resolve for me (and very slow in responding to). Eventually, I tried quitting the beta program and, joy, the problems all went away. Advice: don't join the beta program.

The service itself is decent, lots of servers to choose from, most of them are hot garbage, but once you find the ones that work for you then you're golden. However their servers are flagged by just about every respectable company, so if you're hoping for access to another country's Netflix or like googling something without doing multiple captchas, then this isn't for you. The android app is also terrible and consistently connects on its own, and refuses to disconnect when asked.

Two big changes in the latest update: 1. Can now use chromecast without turning off the VPN. 2. VPN now silently turns itself off in the background. Very happy about #1, but #2 is a dealbreaker for me if it's not fixed as I want the VPN on 24/7. And to be clear, I have turned off battery optimization for the app, that doesn't fix the problem. This is easily a 5 star product if that issue is fixed, doesn't noticeably slow speeds and very has issues connecting.

Overall a really good VPN app. I have run into a few problems, like sometimes the VPN just automatically disconnects. Other than that it is great. Some feedback would be: it would nice to have the location selector as a map rather than a list, and the user can click on the country.

I like the idea of this app but it's just not there yet. Not too happy with the latest update either. When you clear your apps the vpn connection clears as well. There is also no option to auto-start with your device on PC or android which should be standard. I'm going to stick with the service a little bit longer to see if they will make beneficial changes as I realize the service is fairly new. However, these changes need to be made asap if they want to keep people around.

DO NOT USE - APP IS BROKEN Customer Service has informed me they currently have no fix for the app turning itself off multiple times a day without warning. Use another VPN. Will update if they ever fix this. Was happy until the latest update, the app now turns itself off in the background multiple times a day. Reached out to support and they never responded. Do not use.

Great experience so far! Simple user interface and works well. Read about various issues on other reviews but I really experiences None of that. Tried to stop the app running in the foreground and it still continued to run fine. Hope that Mozilla continues to do well and support a free internet!

Good because it has kill switch functionality (unlike Google's VPN), has IPv6 connectivity, supports Windows 10, is cheap, is fast, allows five devices, and is run by a trustworthy US company. Bad in that it can't tell two Pixel 4 devices apart and only allows Internet access from the most recent to log in. Also wouldn't load correctly after an upgrade to Android 11 until I reflashed the device (to 11). American servers are apparently linked to Europe, so some sites see me in the UK or Romania.

Fundamentally broken since last update. Connection unstable (which sometimes it admits, saying no internet connection (clearly is)). Other times it'll say it's connected but it clearly isn't as apps complain about lack of internet. Battery optimisation exempted and marked as always on VPN.

Edit: 4/1/2021 App is working better now, but with less functionality than launch. I've kept my original review below for reference. This app worked great until an update made it impossible to log in. When I asked about a fix they provided nothing! Do not subscribe to Mozilla VPN if you are expecting to use the android version.
Good experience works well wish there wasn't a limit on the number of devices per account or atleast a larger limit with at the moment is 5 devices which isn't too bad just want more availability.
results.replyContent: Hey there! Currently, the number of allowed devices per subscription is 5, but we appreciate you sharing your thoughts with us. Your suggestion will be shared with our extended teams, Warm regards

results.content: Works great. After the update to let the app be persistent, it stays connected indefinitely. The speeds are quite good too. No complaints from me.
It slowed my Desktop computer slower than a snail's pace. I trust the company but a VPN shouldn't slow a computer down like that.

Like the simplicity except... Lowers my Android internet speed from 350 to 50. Won't work on Mac book after install and confirmation. More expensive per month than the, you know, good VPN. Come on Mozilla!
A VPN from an organization I trust. Recent updates have made it very reliable. Over 17 days without a disconnect.
I had a good review but now I'm upset. I turn the VPN off but shortly after it turns it's self back on. I have to force stop or restart the phone in order to remove the tunneling.
Has an occasional issue with connectivity, but other than that, I'm very satisfied this app provides me when I have to use public WiFi.
Needs android home screen widget for easy on/off without having to open the app. Proud to support Mozilla foundation but step it up guys!

Mozilla....i am not having any troubles using your vpn. Great price per month and great app. I am having trouble finding the update for the app here at Google. Any advice on where else i can get the update would be appreciated. Thanks
results.replyContent: Hello! Thank you for your awesome comment! You can make sure you have the latest VPN version by downloading it from vpn.mozilla.org and choosing your respective platform. Warm regards,

results.content: Android OS v 9 Fastest VPN Ive used VPN is not slowing me down to where I can notice I guess using split tunnel If I lose VPN there is a kill switch Lots of servers I am not losing any connections as reported Tested torrent speeds no issues Well rated encryption I like it
Increased rating to ***** because the problem of the VPN disconnecting has been recently fixed. Definitely recommend this now.
Very easy to use. Especially for seniors. Truly trust this app.
The latest update has an 'Open vpn at startup', excellent job guys. This was the apps only lack, now it's perfect... üëçüëçüëç
The VPN randomly turning itself on is a problem since most streaming apps require it to be off.
I really like this app. Only issue is it turns it self off sometimes.
results.replyContent: Hello, We appreciate your awesome comment! If the VPN is disconnecting by itself on your device, try signing out of the Mozilla VPN, uninstalling it, re-downloading it, and reinstalling it. The sign out is an important part of the process due to deleting some files that otherwise don't get purged. That should solve your issue, best regards.

results.content: Fine except it turns itself off frequently and has to be turned back on manually.
A great, cheap, reliable VPN. I can sleep soundly knowing Mozilla and Mullvad protect my information.
Love the simplicity and reliability... and the peace of mind.
results.replyContent: Thank you for sharing your awesome comment! We're always striving to improve our products and your feedback is invaluable in that goal! Warm regards,

results.content: Easy to use. There's no organization I'd trust more with privacy than Mozilla.
No issues and they made it turn on automatically which is great
It works good, but you have to turn it on every time.
results.replyContent: Hello! Unfortunately, the auto-start isn't an auto-connect feature. It will simply start the app up when you start the computer. You still have to manually toggle the VPN on. We are sorry for the inconvenience. We have received a lot of feedback regarding a desire for auto-connect, and we are looking to add it very soon. Warm regards,

results.content: Keeps on turning off since the last update. The update also reset the unprotected apps list. Before that, whenever I moved out of range of a wifi signal but stay connected to cellular, it would lose connection a lot and I would need to manually reset it - it's really annoying to have to do. Edit: It's been a few weeks and it's still like this. I stuck on for another monthhoping it would be changed back but if this doesn't get fixed soon, I'm unsubcribing.

So I have more or less always enjoyed firefox, all bias aside it doesn't seem to like to run for long periods of time. After a length of time it has a connection issue but doesn't notify you or doesn't even show a connection issue at all. But None of your calls or texts will go through and browsers will fail to load websites. This is my only issue. Although turning it off and back on seems to fix it, just have to do that regularly...

The last update to this app has rendered it useless. It now runs as a foreground app instead of background. It continually shuts down, presumably being killed by Android Adaptive Battery because you're not using it. It is also too easy to accidentally close it when clearing open apps. In one update they've gone from a great app to a useless one. I'm paying for an always on VPN that isn't always on unless I constantly check and restart it. Will cancel unless change is reverted.
Fantastic app great price very good value for money
results.replyContent: Thank you for your awesome comment! We're always striving to improve our products and your feedback is invaluable in that goal!

results.content: DO NOT CURRENTLY PICK UP THIS APP! As per a few other reviewers, I have been noticing that with battery optimization turned off for the app it has been silently shutting itself down... Utterly deal breaking for the purpose of a VPN, I will happily 5 star if it ever gets fixed as it was working perfectly for my uses until the last patch.
Occasionally causes connection problems in some apps

Every time this app updates, I hold my breath--each update has an equal chance of fixing an issue or creating a new one. Since the last update it will not run in the background (i.e. every time I "clear" my apps, it disconnects).

What am I paying for? Well, after that last "update" I have to take 3 stars back. Now the app closes, unless you are very careful to leave it running. So you can't hit close all and have it stay running. Bad show. Fix your program.
This app does not mask the location, maybe 25% of the time.
Current version of app repeatedly and randomly turns off. Works great on the PC. We pay a monthly fee for the service, thus to have no solution is not acceptable.
App needs to stay open/minimized for VPN to stay connected. It does not stay on in the background or accesible through notification bar, if that makes sense.
results.replyContent: Hello! I would like to clarify the VPN should remain active while in the background. If you wouldn‚Äôt mind sending us a DM, we'll be more than happy to look into this for you so we can further assist you. Best regards,

results.content: At the most inconvenient times, this app will simply refuse to connect to a server. Really a downer. Also you have to keep the app on in order for it to stay connected.

Works perfectly, no interruptions or lag when streaming or downloading, whether over WiFi or data. I think the 'connection lost' notifications the others are complaining about are normal brief connection hiccups that you'd see when using any VPN app, it's just that most don't give you notifications for it. As long as the key icon doesn't go away, you won't have any problems. The one minor complaint I have is that it doesn't give you advanced options like protocol and kill switch and such.

I was super happy with this VPN until the latest update. Now it takes it upon itself to shut off when clearing open apps on my phone which I absolutely dislike, but figured I'd just deal with that inconvenience and would just keep it open..... then I got the nice surprise of it just turning itself off randomly even when left open in the background, and that's just unacceptable. I will have to cancel my subscription since it's worthless to me now.

Simple with very fast connect/disconnect but user interface is poor. It is supposed to auto-select your connection location but you can't tell if it was manually or auto-selected - really lame! On Android there appears to no way to automatically start when using public Wi-Fi - a very basic feature that any VPN client should have. It seems very reliable and reasonably fast but has some really serious flaws.

Easy to use with the one-tap function, a lot of different locations to use from. Thank you :) Update: 29/1/2021 the app can no longer run in the background i.e. can only work when it's opened, not something I want to have constantly open. Update: 30/1/2021. I have been informed by Mozilla support that this is intentional with their newest update, which is quite disappointing. I shall be looking for alternatives.

I'm a loyal Mozilla user but this is disappointing. Been looking for a VPN that doesn't conflict with my calling app (Sideline). I just installed this app a week ago, and can't get signed in to my Firefox account. After entering user/pass, the app craps out. Error during the authentication process. I can't even get to the dashboard of the app, let alone use it. Other reviews say Mozilla has had bugs with this app for months. Come on guys, get it together! You're better than this..... right?
Latest update broke this app. VPN turns off when you close all apps unlike prior. VPN also turns off randomly and no longer is able to stay running in the background.

Great app! This is my 1st x using a vpn. I know it's working bc any secure acct I have (ie; bank account, crypto, govt., etc.) forces me to do up to 5 of those captcha puzzles cause it looks like I'm logging on from so many random countries, which let's me know what accounts take security seriously and which ones don't. It's a little bit of a hassle but less hassle than my private info being hacked while using strange WiFi networks. Thanks Mozilla! üòòüíØ‚ûï‚ûï‚ûï. (On my Motorola MotoX4 {xt1900-1})

Mozilla has a lot of work to do if they're going to make this service successful. I've been using this for a few months now, and it's still very buggy. The newest update causes my VPN to drop after like 5 minutes. I want to support this to make it better, but I need to see some real improvement if I'm going to keep paying for this.

Good until the last update. Now on Android the VPN shuts itself off every few hours and has to be manually restarted. That means I can't use the "always on VPN" and "block connections without VPN" features without experiencing silent loss of connectivity. It still works normally on PC.

It was working great, but last few days stuck on attempting to confirm connection. I've cleared cache, data, uninstalled reinstalled. Nothing works. It doesn't matter the location and attempts to connect are really laggy. It needs to be fixed.
Good, just take a little extra out of the battery.
It was working perfecting before this month, but now it's just stuck on connecting until I flip the switch off after waiting for 5 minutes.

Great experience so far, fast speeds! Edit: 2/2 I have been using app daily and have had no issues; however, with latest update the vpn connection closes when closing the app. There is no way to keep the vpn connection active if you want to clear the app from the recently viewed list. Please fix this!!
App has always be open. No kill switch. Cannot connect to google play store with block all connections enabled. Please work on these features, thank you.
Finally fixed being able to sign in and now the vpn only stays on while the app is open so it's Basically pointless. Definitely still needs work.

The default servers closest to where I live use Wireguard most of the time, which means there is very little (<10%) latency. Download, install, and bam, instant VPN that passes all the leak tests. With a price lower than most, monthly billing, and Mozilla's reputation & transparency, what's not to like?

Took payment, said card error and told me to contact support which is only accessible after the paywall. Not good. Contacted the bank to block the transaction. What a faff. All resolved eventually and the VPN works well.

Im having a problem after the latest update, as soon as I back out of the app it immediately disconnects me. I have to push the home button while in the app to keep it open as a background app and stay connected
I love it! Easy to install and use! It does not "drop out" like some of f the VPNs I have used in the past which can leave you unknowingly exposed! I highly recommend this VPN! :)
Since the last updat the vpn randomly disconnects and the app quits. If not fixed very soon I'll have to cancel my subscription.

Latest update makes no sense. My personal theory is that Mozilla turns your VPN off now because their infrastructure can't handle "always on" connections. They timeout or straight up kill your connection to conserve bandwidth.
Not free. Nowhere does it say requires subscription. Only tells you after you give them your email. this is a scummy practice
Works great, easy to use. I appreciate Mozilla stance on privacy and have no problem sending them a few bucks a month for this service. Good job, Mozilla.

2021 UPDATE: it now shuts completely off when you close it from the open apps window, NOT COOL! I want the app on without having to have/see the window open. I will cancel my service if this is not reverted quickly. From 5 stars to 1
When I first installed VPN I selected my home area and that was good. Now I have updated I can only see Australia lists! Please fix!
There are a lot of bogus reviews here. This is a simple VPN and any regular user can figure it out. I've never 'felt' a speed decrease while using this and Mozilla is a trustworthy entity
As a fan of Firefox and of privacy, I really wanted this to work consistently but it unfortunately did not. At least they refunded my $5 no questions asked.
Was working great, now it stops working every so often since the new update. When it does work it's amazing though.
I've seen a lot of negative reviews but personally I haven't experienced any problems. Works perfectly and the connecting is stable and fast.
App doesn't run in background. I lose connection if I close the app. Seriously? You people realize it's 2021 and I paid for this, right?
I expected a free VPN Service from Mozilla. Plenty of others offering it freely - so disappointed that Mozilla is milking money for it.
Wow. Yes. Simple. Fast. Faster than others. Doesnt break my websites (except prime video but w.e less website broken than prev. Used vpn)
The app had an error for five months or so that rendered the app unusable. The error has since been fixed for me.
Good idea, but slowed down my device way too much, and it would turn off without notifying me that it was turning off.
In new update a serious bug... When the app is closed the VPN is disconnected. Terrible wrong useless behavior.
New update makes it so the vpn can't run in background, and the notification icon is no longer silent. Awful update.
Working great again after the update
Cant go past the login screen. Typed in password and stuck at the login
The last update made the app useless. It can't stay on as a background app anymore. What a great job!
Very buggy and constantly disconnecting. Plus internet speed drop quite significantly.
randomly disconnects after the latest update
Works flawlessly for me. When is the Android TV version coming out? At minimum, access to the apk PLEASE! üò•
Pretty good but occasionally it can't find a server.
Excellent and convenient, especially after Brexit cut off the UK from European Content
It asked me to sign up and login to my account for me just to find out that it is not available in my region
Easy to use No problems encountered.
Beeps constantly that it is off- not true. Can't turn it off.
Works good. Needs a Linux client.
App Keeps Turning Off, What's up with that?
no issues, stable service.
A great idea, but needs a free trial to show you users the benefits
Turns itself off repeatedly. Congratulations on making your app totally useless with one update.
Comforting to have bothered devices covered. On one ISP complains about email transactions about 2x a month in a volume of about 100 messages a day.

Had this app for a while but started noticing a decline in quality. Originally 4 stars, but now its 2, possibly 1 for multiple reasons. The app used to work without notifications, now it doesnt. It will shutdown if you close the app- it didn't do that before. and also, unlike most VPNs it doesnt have a "Start on Startup" option (not even on PC). It would be nice as well to include an android button (in the drop down menu) to quickly turn on or off the vpn.
It's a VPN and it works good

Dreadful app. Signing in takes you back to the 'Get started' page, then clicking 'Get started' takes you back to the sign in page and you end up in a never ending loop. This eventually seems to resolve itself, but then it won't connect to the network. It behaves like a beta version that you have to pay for, and not even a very good beta version. Predictably, the payment process works seamlessly.

You have to pay! It should say that at the top here. People should know that before they download it. There isn't even a free trial, you simply cannot use the VPN until you sign up for a subscription. Expensive too. And you can't pay with your account here, you have to give them your card details which will make it difficult to cancel. Expected better from Mozilla but now I know different.. Not so community spirited then. Uninstalled.
App frequently crashes, disconnects. Wont stay connected. I frequently have e to reset the app sometimes even the phone before it'll connect. This is daily... on 2 brand new different androids

I'm still evaluating and giving Mozilla time to work out bugs, but so far VPN works hit 'n miss between 1 desktop, 1 laptop and 1 smartphone. I get a lot of "unstable" notifications on the laptop, and the phone and laptop get knocked off the web a lot during light, normal use. When it's working well, it's invisible to me, but the glitches are annoying. Glad to upgrade review/stars when performance reliably improves.

This app has a lot of problems. It can frequently refuse to connect, requiring a restart. If you cancel your repeat subscription, it won't let you use it at all. You get stuck in a loop of signing in and being welcomed to the VPN. It's terrible, I shouldn't have purchased a subscription for it. Disappointed with Mozilla üòî
Works well for me.
results.replyContent: We're always striving to improve our products and your feedback is invaluable in that goal. Thank you for your awesome comment!

results.content: When it works, it works well though some apps and websites seem to know if you are using a VPN, so this doesn't always trick things into thinking you are somewhere else. Throughput is generally very good. But the app often stops without obvious warning. You need to regularly verify that you are actually on the VPN.

I am a big fan of Mozilla in general and when I saw that they were making a VPN I jumped at the chance to try it out. I paid for it and downloaded the desktop app and mobile app and had a very poor experience. The desktop app failed to connect properly but it did eventually let me connect. I then downloaded the app and it was an even worse experience. I can't sign in and everytime they "send an email" to verify my identity I NEVER recieve it, making the mobile app useless. I expected better.

Love it, but occasionally it stops working and rebooting the phone doesn't fix it, the only fix is to log out of Mozilla and log in again. This is actually pretty easy but it's a pain in the ass figuring it out. Also, doesn't support Android TV and this is a major gap in that I hope to see filled.
App silently quits at random intervals. Not a particularly good feature in a background app. Worked fairly well before the last major update.
Without VPN: 500Mbps / 10ms ping ... With VPN: 0.20Mbps - 42ms ping. That's across all servers. Literally, I have tested 40 servers and None go over 1Mbps. Can someone sue them? This can't be legal.

Worked until I rebooted my phone and went into the app, where no server regions were showing at all. Clicked connect and presented with "please check your network and try again" redownloading the app doesn't help either. Can't manage account in app or recalibrate the vpn install. The nly solution I had was turning on mobile data, forgetting the device and reinstalling the vpn service on my account. Horrible experience that I'm paying for.

Circular experience. Despite multiple attempts & pathways, VPN would not open. I like Firefox, but what I thought would be great VPN turned out to be a failure. And Help button shown in display is not even available on Get Started screen.

Worked great on my Galaxy 9+ but could not be installed on Android-TV ver. 9.0. App is not listed in Google play store at all for Android-TV. There is NO customer support! Cannot email support. Faceburg required to ask for support... or post to a Forum, ie NO SUPPORT! Not ready for prime time.
Simple to setup and use. I wish it had a dark mode

Terrible. It used to work well and after an update it hasn't logged in anymore. An endless looping in the Get Started page. I called to the support and their answer were "Our engineers are hard working to solve it". This call was 2 months ago and the problem persists. It's a shame.
Easy to use. I found that I needed to close the apps from the task switcher that I wanted to connect through the VPN and then starting them again for them to switch, but otherwise easy to use.
After the latest update the app became incapable of communicate with Mozilla that means you're locked out, there's nobody there to help you. So much for a "well stablished" company. This sucks.
Works great for me! Hopefully they add a feature to detect the fastest VPN automatically, buy for now I've had great speeds with the manually selected servers in the US.

I cant say much... Its useless without the paid service. Just make the app cost the price of first month's service in google play. Then offer 1 month "free" like the rest of the paid apps doüòâ. Good luck on the project...

Complete VPN for android, connection occasionally indicates unstable and causes drops in use. For all around use, it is a good service on my phone. Easy setup and relevant, nonobtrusive network status built in.
For the most part, the app gets the simple job done. But sometimes it refuses to find a server and I have to Uninstall and reinstall the app to get it to work.

Unuseable on mobile devices currently. Log-in menu sends you back to the startup menu without loging you in. Means you can't actually get into the app to use the VPN you pay for. Pretty embarrassing TBH.
endless logg in loop, got it to work on pc but trick didnt work on my phone . How is this a issue. Update please. Works well when you can get it to open will uninstall and not pay
I uninstalled this app and unsicribed to it but it will not stop charging me every month. It doesnt give contact information for me to settled the dispute. IT IS ROBBING ME EVERY MONTH!!!
Gets you to sign up via email and to marketing spam... And only then tells you it's a paid for service.
Its easy to use and it protects.

I have been using this app for about a week. Constantly dropping the connection, as in like every 5-10 minutes. Must be an Android/ARM issue. I would like to blame it on my phone, but my other VPN works fine. However, I believe it is using OpenVPN/UDP protocol. Also using it on my Windows machine and have had zero issues with connection drops. Mozilla people, please also implement a simple kill switch for all future releases. Also have tried different DNS's and still get consistent drops. Don't make me re-up with Nord. I have three months left with them. And please add Linux support soon. Like within three months. LOL
Extremely easy to use app and very reliable. Never had any problems across my laptop, desktop, and phone
Good, but doesn't allow connecting to streaming sticks on android app. There is an option to enable this on the desktop app, please add this to the mobile app too.

Unlike every free VPN service out there, Mozilla VPN uses Mullvad's infrastructure. Mullvad is one of only 3 VPNs who are trustworthy about your data and privacy. This alone makes the $4.99/month worth it to me. But on top of that, the features are great. All of my devices are still able to achieve the same dl and ul speeds as they always have. Also, you can set your location to be many different places spanning the world. And the easy to use interface makes it very simple to do so.

So, the VPN itself is decent (ok latency and bandwidth), but the fact that it's made by Mozilla (with nullvad running point) makes it great! BUT. Its so damn annoying to have the app say "New features available! Update now" without saying what the 'new features' are, only to have bug fixes listed (which are important, but still) ;-;

Two main drawbacks 1. The connection unstable notification doesn't disappear when connection is fixed (say a momentary drop) 2. I cannot cast to devices (say, a Chromecast) to stream media while VPN is active. If the two issues above were to be fixed, this would be a 5 star review. It's fast, there's plenty of options, and I get over 85mbps on my WiFi when VPN is active. The service itself is solid.
Most recent update has broken the VPN. I can no longer connect on mobile data or wifi. Tried toggling IPv6 but no luck.
Will not work on pixel 4 anymore. Customer support is no help. They just tell me to reinstall, which I've tried several times. Express it is.

Downloaded and ran fine a week ago. Used twice. Today trying to use and every time I open the app, it says :signed out and device removed" in a banner at the bottom for a cpuple seconds then leaves me at Get Started page. I try to sign in (pw is saved) and it spins and takes me right back to get started. On my PC it shows my phone as an authorized device still. Tried deleting device and signing back in on phone again, same result. First time I signed up for a VPN, this sucks.

This is a very good vpn. At first l was disappointed when, after waking the phone from sleep, the vpn would be "dead" or would signal an unstable connection. I suspected it was my phone (OnePlus 7t Android 10) and turns out it was, as the app was being prevented from running in the background. But apps can be "locked", keeping the app running. This I have done and it works as it should.

I'm very happy with Mozilla VPN. I trust an organization that is concerned with privacy plus this service simply works. The reason for the Mozilla account is for billing purposes. However, a Mozilla account has other advantages as well such as syncing bookmarks across your devices. I have no issues with that requirement at all. Good job Mozilla!

It's hard to argue with others on here who are miffed that they don't mention that this is a paid service with no free option, but that's not why I'm only giving three stars as I knew that from the Mozilla mail out I am received. The reasons it didn't get more are simple. It is reasonably - but not especially - fast, and it is simple enough to use. The main problem is that the app will not run on startup and has to be started manually. This is a huge issue that they need to fix asap

I've personally not had any of the issues I'm seeing people report. I leave the app running 24/7 on phone and PC. No speed issues, disconnecting issues or anything like that. I've used PIA, Express, and Nord I have literally they exact same experience no matter which I use... except PIA which doesn't work across tons of networks. I highly recommend Mozilla VPN!
Fails to function - it won't let me log in when getting started, and constantly asks me to log in again.

I began subbing to this for few reasons: to support Mozilla foundation, and since Cloudflare in my area gets rerouted I couldn't get to my websites or they're terribly slow to load so I have to find a way around. So far some VPN locations available that I tried were reportedly unstable once connected, but others that work are pretty fast albeit further away.
Very clean, no issues, and an org I trust

I don't understand why people think that this service is free. Any VPN out on the market which is free is not safe for your device or your data. Mozilla VPN costs 5 USD which is a competitive price compared to the other services on the market. The application Is integrated with Firefox browser very well and does exactly what it is supposed to do. One thing that is missing (compared with other VPN services) is the annual fee which might make the service slightly cheaper.

The update logged me off, and it wont let me log in, so for the past 15 hours I've had no VPN. I have to put up with endless ghost chimes, like when I get a text, now an update to fix bugs, has completely shut down the app and VPN for me, and I'm paying for this, WHY?
Simple, does the job and fast with Wireguard. Excellent connection to London servers! (my local area)

Actually, Mozilla VPN sucks! It won't let me select a server located in Toronto, Canada; nor will it connect to a server. Also, Mozilla doesn't offer technical support by a human. I'll cancel my subscription.
Frustratingly, it cuts out sometimes and you can't sign in. I want to really like this, it's a great app otherwise.
Got kicked off the net by my ISP straight away, there are no settings to fine tune this!!! Avoid!!!
Does not work at all. Sign in/Get started loop of death. Desktop version works great.

Choosing location is pointless. Seems random. From UK, Tiktok sometimes thinks I'm in Spain so my Live streams are all in foreigneeze..... ! Doesn't auto start with Android. Have to manually start it. Kill switch needs setting up manually too....which if you don't know about...means your security is at risk ! Constant slow downs and disconnect s don't help either. Member of 14 eyes too ! You get what you pay for I guess. Better going with established decent app like Nord or ExpressVPN.

Mozilla is a company with the goal of complete internet privacy. If their vpn subscription isn't paid for, Firefox would have to rely on selling user data, which is against their objective, so I understand and wish to pay that premium for their vpn service. What I don't understand is why Mozilla decided that using Java script foor their payment system was a good idea, as I can't use it on mobile. Please fix this issue.

This app though I'm a paid user has just stopped working irregardless of what browser and how many times I clear the storage and cache of the browsers or the app it just hangs when I try to sign in. Ive reinstalled both the app and browsers many times, reset my network settings and tried on both WiFi and mobile Data it is not working.

Have been using since start, always good connection speeds but I don't like that it limits to 5 log-ins. I have 2 user accounts on my desktop and that takes us 2 of my 5. I like the kill switch but don't like that it doesn't automaticlaly connect so I always have to remember to turn it on. I was logged out with the recent update but seem to have logged back in in successfully.......... I like to support Mozilla products so want to stick with this but you aren't making it a no-brainer.

Great speed, device compatibility, low battery usage and value for money after two weeks of using it! Above all, Mozilla is among a very few trustworthy (in user data privacy) internet companies and so as its VPN. Highly recommended!

Seems to work OK. Kill switch is good. But why can't it auto start on boot up ? Crazy ! Main problem is that selected servers seem random. If I go to London, my Tiktok feeds are from Spain....! This is NOT good. Also, Netflix etc knows you're using a VPN so you cannot remove geo restrictions like you can with better VONs like Nord or Express. Guess you get what you pay for. As for the moaners... Free VPNs should be avoided. Not reliable or secure !
Resubscribed again to see if things had improved. Not really. Im subscribed to mullvad directly now.
results.replyContent: Hello! We're sorry if the experience with our VPN hasn't satisfied your needs. We are constantly working to improve and your feedback is very important for us. If you would like to share your experience with us don't hesitate to send us a message through the "Contact us" option within the settings of the VPN. Best regards,

results.content: Once again, Mozilla adding junk when the basics that made the browser brilliant are gone. Ugh.

1. This app works great on my computer. 2. This app does not work at all on my Android phone, HTC U12+. I see "500 Error" and then this idiotically insulting message: "Oh dear, something went wrong there. We've been notified and will get working on a fix." I've been using Mozilla Firefox and Mozilla Thunderbird since the beginning. This patronizing childish response is not what I want nor what I would have expected from Mozilla. I am not in kindergarten. I

Good VPN. Needs a way to enable auto-start on device boot or similar function. I don't mind starting the VPN after every reboot, but e.g. my wife never remember to do it so she isn't getting the service we're paying for. Please add the auto start feature!
Switched from Proton to this. Connections are fast and the service is cheaper. Only downside is the app is very barebones, it needs the ability to start with Android boot.

Must say it's quite disappointing, as it seems to be a free downloadable VPN, but you actually have to subscribe to it to work, though that isn't a problem, the problem is the mixed reviews of it, people either said that it's slow or it's secure If that's the case, I'll rather choose other subscription services as they are much cheaper and probably faster

This is a rebranded Mullvad VPN with assurances that activity logs aren't stored. Great way to support a great company (Mozilla) and knowing they have your back in regards to your privacy. Mozilla's focus on free software (free as in freedom) is a noble one and why I'll continue supporting them.

Download and paid for, but I can't log in anymore. Worked fine for like 2 weeks. Suddenly, I can't log in and everytime I try, it just goes back to the login screen. If I pay for something, I expect it to work.

Mozilla is one of the most highly trusted advocates for personal privacy and close partners with the EFF. We have seen a roll-out of several new privacy features built into Firefox this year, and they could not come at a more critical time. In this day and age, I am so deeply grateful for Mozilla and all the work they have done to ensure that the people have online freedom of expression and protection from the chilling factor of surveillance. $5/month is an incredible value. Thank you, Mozilla.
Simple, easy app to use, and it feels good to be supporting Mozilla. I've been a happy customer of Mullvad for over a year now, so it's convenient for me that they use the same infrastructure.
Easy to use and no issues with speed. My mobile network provider can detect I'm using a VPN and when I leave WiFi and hit the mobile network, apps, internet, etc cease to work.

App is now broken - worked before but has now signed me out and will not let me log back in, just sends me in a loop. Was good and trusted before but now paying for an unusable service and looks like I'm not the only one from looking at the other reviews recently.
Since the most recent update, I'm unable to log into the vpn. Asks me to sign in, but takes me back to the "Get Started" page. Even reset password, and reinstalled the app. I'm very disappointed.

The app states that the connection is unstable on my Samsung Galaxy S7. I tried using the different servers and it still comes with the same message. In fact it deteriorates even further saying eventually that there is no signal. The app works perfectly on my 2 PCs, so I think this is am issue with the Android app only.

Masquerading as a free app is a poor choice in any instance and there's simply no excuse for such fallacies. Is not until the user tries to ''Get Started'' with Mozilla VPN you then realize it is a premium service you are expected to buy monthly from the get go. I'm generally a Mozilla fan, or at least I was, but this is low by any standards.

It works on my computer. That's it. I downloaded it for my phone since I use that more often. However there is no indication its active at all. When using it on my comupter it says there is only one device connected. I've tried finding a solution but there is nothing about the android version I can see. All it does is ask to get started and then redirects back to the app.

I have used this VPN for a few months now and it's been very good on all of my devices including my laptop and iPhone. But now I have switched to an android phone and this VPN doesn't seem to work properly. It works okay on wifi but when I switch to cellular data it no longer allows for internet access. Very disappointed.
App doesn't work. Login screen keeps kicking me back after I hit the sign in button.

I've installed, uninstalled and reinstalled the app twice, but it didn't run at all. ( through a WiFi 16 MB/s connection with Version 9 Android on my phone using cpu kirin 659, RAM 4.0 GB, Int. Storage 64 GB & SD 32 GB).

Now when launching the app, and even though I just logged in into my Firefox browser, Mozilla VPN keeps asking me again and again for my email and password by returning to the login page of the VPN (no error message or wrong login).
Simple and functional, works great for me. Used to suffer if left open in the background for days, but updates solved that. Could use a dark mode if not already in the app.
The idea is great and I will come back to that service when it is complete. Functionalities are really limited, no Linux support and it disconnects by itself intermittently.
The app disconnects automatically for no reason.
Stuck in a never ending loop that never lets you get signed in. Very disappointed.
After looking for some kind of VPN to use and have confidence that it works I'm glad Mozilla had made one. It works really well and gives me low ping on the desktop version for gaming.
Easy to install and use. But it does not automatically restart when you restart your phone! And like all VPN apps, it really eats your battery.

Zero stars for letting me install and make an account before telling me it's a subscription service. Sneaky and underhanded loses my trust. I don't see anywhere on the initial Google Play store page that indicates it's a subscription service. Shame on me for not digging deeper but shame on you for not being upfront. If you were being upfront the process wouldn't tell you after account creation it would be obvious before. Sneaky sneaky. Bye bye.
Works well on a laptop. Horrible on android. If you plan on downloading this app on your phone, just expect a ton of crashes and errors.
Used to be great. The latest update has completely broken the login process though. Logging in just boots you back to the login screen...needs a fix ASAP.
I can definitely tell when it's running.I stop being able to get a signal, first wifi, then altogether. I wanted this to work. It just didn't.

Best vpn app according to my opinion. Works better than previous VPN apps that I tried using in the past. It's very secure and super fast and easy to use. A very friendly app and the price is worth it. Great job with app.
Does exactly what I need and want. Very cost effective and will only improve as more places are added. Good functionality and very simple to use, looking forward to updates and improvements.
This is one of few VPNS that I have tried that doesn't slow down my connection. I am very happy with the product and as a bonus it comes at a very inexpensive price.
One star because zero not an option. Intolerably slow or page doesn't load at all. Have happily used Firefox for more years than I can count. VPN is horrible. Nothing like search engine.
I can use this app on my windows and chromebook. But on my phone, it is stuck on the sign in page. It just shows it's loading.
Very good app. I can't give 5 stars because from time to time I get 'no signal check your internet connection' when my internet is fine
App doesnt work. Stuck in a loop between get started screen and sign in screen, just going between both indefinitely. Get started -> sign in -> get started -> sign in etc.

Downloaded only to spend 10 minutes registering and found no free option. I am surprised Mozilla have stooped so low when they've always been so 'doing everything for its customers'. Well now I've spent another 10 minutes warning everyone else. 20 minutes wasted. Damn you !
Was working before update, but like some people have mentioned I can longer log in, keeps taking me back to get started screen over and over. Will give them 1 week before I find some othe VPN.

It's exactly what it says on the tin! Great VPN, good speed, and most importantly it stands by all of Mozilla's principals.
While its occasionally buggy, it's the first phone VPN I've used that's worth a dang. This does full device VPN.
Work really well but needs certain features like safe WiFi list, automatic switch on when connected to mobile networks, exemption list etc.

results.replyContent: Hello there! The kill switch is on all the time and you can't switch it off. If the VPN is on and the network gets cut, the WireGuard protocol and the Mozilla VPN will block the traffic until you switch the VPN off. Warm regards,
